configuration.name: syntax
configuration.description: Whether to use the `long` or `short` array syntax.

array_syntax.summary: PHP arrays should be declared using the configured syntax (requires PHP >= 5.4 for short syntax).

configuration.name: align_double_arrow
configuration.description: Whether to apply, remove or ignore double arrows alignment.

configuration.name: align_equals
configuration.description: Whether to apply, remove or ignore equals alignment.

binary_operator_spaces.summary: Binary operators should be surrounded by at least one space.

blank_line_after_namespace.summary: There MUST be one blank line after the namespace declaration.

blank_line_after_opening_tag.summary: Ensure there is no code on the same line as the PHP open tag and it is followed by a blank line.

blank_line_before_return.summary: An empty line feed should precede a return statement.

configuration.name: allow_single_line_closure
configuration.description: Whether single line lambda notation should be allowed.

configuration.name: position_after_functions_and_oop_constructs
configuration.description: whether the opening brace should be placed on "next" or "same" line after classy constructs (non-anonymous classes, interfaces, traits, methods and non-lambda functions).

braces.summary: The body of each structure MUST be enclosed by braces. Braces should be properly placed. Body of braces should be properly indented.

codeSamples.from:
<?php

class Foo {
    public function bar($baz) {
        if ($baz = 900) echo "Hello!";

        if ($baz = 9000)
            echo "Wait!";

        if ($baz == true)
        {
            echo "Why?";
        }
        else
        {
            echo "Ha?";
        }

        if (is_array($baz))
            foreach ($baz as $b)
            {
                echo $b;
            }
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

class Foo
{
    public function bar($baz)
    {
        if ($baz = 900) {
            echo "Hello!";
        }

        if ($baz = 9000) {
            echo "Wait!";
        }

        if ($baz == true) {
            echo "Why?";
        } else {
            echo "Ha?";
        }

        if (is_array($baz)) {
            foreach ($baz as $b) {
                echo $b;
            }
        }
    }
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

class Foo
{
    public function bar($baz)
    {
        if ($baz = 900) echo "Hello!";

        if ($baz = 9000)
            echo "Wait!";

        if ($baz == true)
        {
            echo "Why?";
        }
        else
        {
            echo "Ha?";
        }

        if (is_array($baz))
            foreach ($baz as $b)
            {
                echo $b;
            }
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

class Foo {
    public function bar($baz) {
        if ($baz = 900) {
            echo "Hello!";
        }

        if ($baz = 9000) {
            echo "Wait!";
        }

        if ($baz == true) {
            echo "Why?";
        } else {
            echo "Ha?";
        }

        if (is_array($baz)) {
            foreach ($baz as $b) {
                echo $b;
            }
        }
    }
}

cast_spaces.summary: A single space should be between cast and variable.

configuration.name: multi_line_extends_each_single_line
configuration.description: Whether definitions should be multiline.

configuration.name: single_item_single_line
configuration.description: Whether definitions should be single line when including a single item.

configuration.name: single_line
configuration.description: Whether definitions should be single line.

class_definition.summary: Whitespace around the keywords of a class, trait or interfaces definition should be one space.

codeSamples.from:
<?php

class  Foo  extends  Bar  implements  Baz,  BarBaz
{
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

class Foo extends Bar implements Baz, BarBaz
{
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

final  class  Foo  extends  Bar  implements  Baz,  BarBaz
{
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

final class Foo extends Bar implements Baz, BarBaz
{
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

$foo = new  class  extends  Bar  implements  Baz,  BarBaz {};
codeSamples.to:
<?php

$foo = new class extends Bar implements Baz, BarBaz {};

codeSamples.from:
<?php

class Foo
extends Bar
implements Baz, BarBaz
{}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

class Foo extends Bar implements Baz, BarBaz
{}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

class Foo
extends Bar
implements Baz
{}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

class Foo extends Bar implements Baz
{}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

interface Bar extends
    Bar, BarBaz, FooBarBaz
{}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

interface Bar extends
    Bar,
    BarBaz,
    FooBarBaz
{}

class_keyword_remove.summary: Converts `::class` keywords to FQCN strings. Requires PHP >= 5.5.

combine_consecutive_unsets.summary: Calling `unset` on multiple items should be done in one call.

configuration.name: spacing
configuration.description: Spacing to apply around concatenation operator.

concat_space.summary: Concatenation should be spaced according configuration.

configuration.name: space
configuration.description: Spacing to apply around the equal sign.

declare_equal_normalize.summary: Equal sign in declare statement should be surrounded by spaces or not following configuration.

declare_strict_types.summary: Force strict types declaration in all files. Requires PHP >= 7.0.
declare_strict_types.riskyDescription: Forcing strict types will stop non strict code from working.

dir_constant.riskyDescription: Risky when the function `dirname` is overridden.

configuration.name: ignored_tags
configuration.description: List of tags that must not be treated as Doctrine Annotations.

configuration.name: syntax
configuration.description: Whether to add or remove braces.

doctrine_annotation_braces.summary: Doctrine annotations without arguments must use the configured syntax.

configuration.name: ignored_tags
configuration.description: List of tags that must not be treated as Doctrine Annotations.

doctrine_annotation_indentation.summary: Doctrine annotations must be indented with four spaces.

configuration.name: around_argument_assignments
configuration.description: Whether to fix spaces around argument assignment operator.

configuration.name: around_array_assignments
configuration.description: Whether to fix spaces around array assignment operators.

configuration.name: around_commas
configuration.description: Whether to fix spaces around commas.

configuration.name: around_parentheses
configuration.description: Whether to fix spaces around parentheses.

configuration.name: ignored_tags
configuration.description: List of tags that must not be treated as Doctrine Annotations.

doctrine_annotation_spaces.description: There must not be any space around parentheses; commas must be preceded by no space and followed by one space; there must be no space around named arguments assignment operator; there must be one space around array assignment operator.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * @Foo ( )
 */
class Bar {}

/**
 * @Foo("bar" ,"baz")
 */
class Bar2 {}

/**
 * @Foo(foo = "foo", bar = {"foo":"foo", "bar"="bar"})
 */
class Bar3 {}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * @Foo()
 */
class Bar {}

/**
 * @Foo("bar", "baz")
 */
class Bar2 {}

/**
 * @Foo(foo="foo", bar={"foo" : "foo", "bar" = "bar"})
 */
class Bar3 {}

elseif.summary: The keyword `elseif` should be used instead of `else if` so that all control keywords look like single words.

encoding.summary: PHP code MUST use only UTF-8 without BOM (remove BOM).

ereg_to_preg.summary: Replace deprecated `ereg` regular expression functions with `preg`.
ereg_to_preg.riskyDescription: Risky if the `ereg` function is overridden.

full_opening_tag.summary: PHP code must use the long `<?php` tags or short-echo `<?=` tags and not other tag variations.

configuration.name: closure_function_spacing
configuration.description: Spacing to use before open parenthesis for closures.

function_declaration.summary: Spaces should be properly placed in a function declaration.

codeSamples.from:
<?php

class Foo
{
    public static function  bar   ( $baz , $foo )
    {
        return false;
    }
}

function  foo  ($bar, $baz)
{
    return false;
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

class Foo
{
    public static function bar($baz , $foo)
    {
        return false;
    }
}

function foo($bar, $baz)
{
    return false;
}

configuration.name: functions
configuration.description: List of function names to fix.

function_to_constant.summary: Replace core functions calls returning constants with the constants.
function_to_constant.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the configured functions to replace are overridden.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
echo phpversion();
echo pi();
echo php_sapi_name();
codeSamples.to:
<?php
echo PHP_VERSION;
echo M_PI;
echo PHP_SAPI;

function_typehint_space.summary: Add missing space between function's argument and its typehint.

configuration.name: annotations
configuration.description: List of annotations to remove, e.g. `["author"]`.

general_phpdoc_annotation_remove.summary: Configured annotations should be omitted from PHPDoc.

hash_to_slash_comment.summary: Single line comments should use double slashes `//` and not hash `#`.

configuration.name: comment_type
configuration.description: Comment syntax type.

configuration.name: header
configuration.description: Proper header content.

configuration.name: location
configuration.description: The location of the inserted header.

configuration.name: separate
configuration.description: Whether the header should be separated from the file content with a new line.

header_comment.summary: Add, replace or remove header comment.

codeSamples.to:
<?php
declare(strict_types=1);

/*
 * Made with love.
 */

namespace A\B;

echo 1;

<?php
/**
 * Made with love.
 */

declare(strict_types=1);

namespace A\B;

echo 1;

<?php
declare(strict_types=1);

/*
 * Made with love.
 */

namespace A\B;

echo 1;

include.summary: Include/Require and file path should be divided with a single space. File path should not be placed under brackets.

indentation_type.summary: Code MUST use configured indentation type.

configuration.name: use_yoda_style
configuration.description: Whether Yoda style conditions should be used.

is_null.riskyDescription: Risky when the function `is_null` is overridden.

line_ending.summary: All PHP files must use same line ending.

linebreak_after_opening_tag.summary: Ensure there is no code on the same line as the PHP open tag.

lowercase_cast.summary: Cast should be written in lower case.

lowercase_constants.summary: The PHP constants `true`, `false`, and `null` MUST be in lower case.

lowercase_keywords.summary: PHP keywords MUST be in lower case.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
    FOREACH($a AS $B) {
        TRY {
            NEW $C($a, ISSET($B));
            WHILE($B) {
                INCLUDE "test.php";
            }
        } CATCH(\Exception $e) {
            EXIT(1);
        }
    }
codeSamples.to:
<?php
    foreach($a as $B) {
        try {
            new $C($a, isset($B));
            while($B) {
                include "test.php";
            }
        } catch(\Exception $e) {
            exit(1);
        }
    }

magic_constant_casing.summary: Magic constants should be referred to using the correct casing.

mb_str_functions.summary: Replace non multibyte-safe functions with corresponding mb function.
mb_str_functions.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the functions are overridden.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
$a = strlen($a);
$a = strpos($a, $b);
$a = strrpos($a, $b);
$a = substr($a, $b);
$a = strtolower($a);
$a = strtoupper($a);
$a = stripos($a, $b);
$a = strripos($a, $b);
$a = strstr($a, $b);
$a = stristr($a, $b);
$a = strrchr($a, $b);
$a = substr_count($a, $b);
codeSamples.to:
<?php
$a = mb_strlen($a);
$a = mb_strpos($a, $b);
$a = mb_strrpos($a, $b);
$a = mb_substr($a, $b);
$a = mb_strtolower($a);
$a = mb_strtoupper($a);
$a = mb_stripos($a, $b);
$a = mb_strripos($a, $b);
$a = mb_strstr($a, $b);
$a = mb_stristr($a, $b);
$a = mb_strrchr($a, $b);
$a = mb_substr_count($a, $b);

configuration.name: keep_multiple_spaces_after_comma
configuration.description: Whether keep multiple spaces after comma.

method_argument_space.summary: In method arguments and method call, there MUST NOT be a space before each comma and there MUST be one space after each comma.

method_separation.summary: Methods must be separated with one blank line.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class Sample
{
    protected function foo()
    {
    }
    protected function bar()
    {
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class Sample
{
    protected function foo()
    {
    }

    protected function bar()
    {
    }
}

modernize_types_casting.summary: Replaces `intval`, `floatval`, `doubleval`, `strval` and `boolval` function calls with according type casting operator.
modernize_types_casting.riskyDescription: Risky if any of the functions `intval`, `floatval`, `doubleval`, `strval` or `boolval` are overridden.

native_function_casing.summary: Function defined by PHP should be called using the correct casing.

configuration.name: exclude
configuration.description: List of functions to ignore.

native_function_invocation.summary: Add leading `\` before function invocation of internal function to speed up resolving.
native_function_invocation.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the functions are overridden.

codeSamples.from:
<?php

function baz($options)
{
    if (!array_key_exists("foo", $options)) {
        throw new \InvalidArgumentException();
    }

    return json_encode($options);
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

function baz($options)
{
    if (!\array_key_exists("foo", $options)) {
        throw new \InvalidArgumentException();
    }

    return \json_encode($options);
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

function baz($options)
{
    if (!array_key_exists("foo", $options)) {
        throw new \InvalidArgumentException();
    }

    return json_encode($options);
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

function baz($options)
{
    if (!\array_key_exists("foo", $options)) {
        throw new \InvalidArgumentException();
    }

    return json_encode($options);
}

new_with_braces.summary: All instances created with new keyword must be followed by braces.

no_alias_functions.summary: Master functions shall be used instead of aliases.
no_alias_functions.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the alias functions are overridden.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
$a = chop($b);
close($b);
$a = doubleval($b);
$a = fputs($b, $c);
ini_alter($b, $c);
$a = is_double($b);
$a = is_integer($b);
$a = is_long($b);
$a = is_real($b);
$a = is_writeable($b);
$a = join($glue, $pieces);
$a = key_exists($key, $array);
magic_quotes_runtime($new_setting);
$a = pos($array);
$a = show_source($filename, true);
$a = sizeof($b);
$a = strchr($haystack, $needle);
codeSamples.to:
<?php
$a = rtrim($b);
closedir($b);
$a = floatval($b);
$a = fwrite($b, $c);
ini_set($b, $c);
$a = is_float($b);
$a = is_int($b);
$a = is_int($b);
$a = is_float($b);
$a = is_writable($b);
$a = implode($glue, $pieces);
$a = array_key_exists($key, $array);
set_magic_quotes_runtime($new_setting);
$a = current($array);
$a = highlight_file($filename, true);
$a = count($b);
$a = strstr($haystack, $needle);

no_blank_lines_after_class_opening.summary: There should be no empty lines after class opening brace.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class Sample
{

    protected function foo()
    {
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class Sample
{
    protected function foo()
    {
    }
}

no_blank_lines_after_phpdoc.summary: There should not be blank lines between docblock and the documented element.

codeSamples.from:
<?php

/**
 * This is the bar class.
 */


class Bar {}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

/**
 * This is the bar class.
 */
class Bar {}

no_blank_lines_before_namespace.summary: There should be no blank lines before a namespace declaration.

no_closing_tag.summary: The closing `?>` tag MUST be omitted from files containing only PHP.

no_empty_comment.summary: There should not be any empty comments.

no_empty_phpdoc.summary: There should not be empty PHPDoc blocks.

configuration.name: tokens
configuration.description: List of tokens to fix.

no_extra_consecutive_blank_lines.summary: Removes extra blank lines and/or blank lines following configuration.

codeSamples.from:
<?php

switch ($foo) {
    case 41:
        echo "foo";
        break;

    case 42:
        break;
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

switch ($foo) {
    case 41:
        echo "foo";
        break;
    case 42:
        break;
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

namespace Foo;

use Bar\Baz;

use Baz\Bar;

class Bar
{
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

namespace Foo;

use Bar\Baz;
use Baz\Bar;

class Bar
{
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php

class Foo
{
    use Bar;

    use Baz;
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php

class Foo
{
    use Bar;
    use Baz;
}

no_leading_namespace_whitespace.summary: The namespace declaration line shouldn't contain leading whitespace.

configuration.name: use
configuration.description: The desired language construct.

no_mixed_echo_print.summary: Either language construct `print` or `echo` should be used.

no_multiline_whitespace_around_double_ar.summary: Operator `=>` should not be surrounded by multi-line whitespaces.

no_multiline_whitespace_before_semicolon.summary: Multi-line whitespace before closing semicolon are prohibited.

no_php4_constructor.riskyDescription: Risky when old style constructor being fixed is overridden or overrides parent one.

no_short_bool_cast.summary: Short cast `bool` using double exclamation mark should not be used.

no_short_echo_tag.summary: Replace short-echo `<?=` with long format `<?php echo` syntax.

no_singleline_whitespace_before_semicolo.summary: Single-line whitespace before closing semicolon are prohibited.

no_spaces_after_function_name.summary: When making a method or function call, there MUST NOT be a space between the method or function name and the opening parenthesis.

configuration.name: positions
configuration.description: Whether spacing should be fixed inside and/or outside the offset braces.

no_spaces_around_offset.summary: There MUST NOT be spaces around offset braces.

no_spaces_inside_parenthesis.summary: There MUST NOT be a space after the opening parenthesis. There MUST NOT be a space before the closing parenthesis.

no_trailing_comma_in_list_call.summary: Remove trailing commas in list function calls.

no_trailing_comma_in_singleline_array.summary: PHP single-line arrays should not have trailing comma.

no_trailing_whitespace.summary: Remove trailing whitespace at the end of non-blank lines.

no_trailing_whitespace_in_comment.summary: There MUST be no trailing spaces inside comment or PHPDoc.

configuration.name: statements
configuration.description: List of control statements to fix.

no_unneeded_control_parentheses.summary: Removes unneeded parentheses around control statements.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
while ($x) { while ($y) { break (2); } }
clone($a);
while ($y) { continue (2); }
echo("foo");
print("foo");
return (1 + 2);
switch ($a) { case($x); }
yield(2);
codeSamples.to:
<?php
while ($x) { while ($y) { break 2; } }
clone $a;
while ($y) { continue 2; }
echo "foo";
print "foo";
return 1 + 2;
switch ($a) { case $x; }
yield 2;

codeSamples.from:
<?php
while ($x) { while ($y) { break (2); } }
clone($a);
while ($y) { continue (2); }
echo("foo");
print("foo");
return (1 + 2);
switch ($a) { case($x); }
yield(2);
codeSamples.to:
<?php
while ($x) { while ($y) { break 2; } }
clone($a);
while ($y) { continue 2; }
echo("foo");
print("foo");
return (1 + 2);
switch ($a) { case($x); }
yield(2);

no_unreachable_default_argument_value.summary: In function arguments there must not be arguments with default values before non-default ones.
no_unreachable_default_argument_value.riskyDescription: Modifies the signature of functions; therefore risky when using systems (such as some Symfony components) that rely on those (for example through reflection).

no_useless_else.summary: There should not be useless `else` cases.

no_useless_return.summary: There should not be an empty `return` statement at the end of a function.

no_whitespace_before_comma_in_array.summary: In array declaration, there MUST NOT be a whitespace before each comma.

no_whitespace_in_blank_line.summary: Remove trailing whitespace at the end of blank lines.

non_printable_character.summary: Remove Zero-width space (ZWSP), Non-breaking space (NBSP) and other invisible unicode symbols.
non_printable_character.riskyDescription: Risky when strings contain intended invisible characters.

normalize_index_brace.summary: Array index should always be written by using square braces.

not_operator_with_space.summary: Logical NOT operators (`!`) should have leading and trailing whitespaces.

not_operator_with_successor_space.summary: Logical NOT operators (`!`) should have one trailing whitespace.

object_operator_without_whitespace.summary: There should not be space before or after object `T_OBJECT_OPERATOR` `->`.

configuration.name: order
configuration.description: List of strings defining order of elements.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class Example
{
    use BarTrait;
    use BazTrait;
    const C1 = 1;
    const C2 = 2;
    protected static $protStatProp;
    public static $pubStatProp1;
    public $pubProp1;
    protected $protProp;
    var $pubProp2;
    private static $privStatProp;
    private $privProp;
    public static $pubStatProp2;
    public $pubProp3;
    protected function __construct() {}
    private static function privStatFunc() {}
    public function pubFunc1() {}
    public function __toString() {}
    protected function protFunc() {}
    function pubFunc2() {}
    public static function pubStatFunc1() {}
    public function pubFunc3() {}
    static function pubStatFunc2() {}
    private function privFunc() {}
    public static function pubStatFunc3() {}
    protected static function protStatFunc() {}
    public function __destruct() {}
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class Example
{
    use BarTrait;
    use BazTrait;
    const C1 = 1;
    const C2 = 2;
    public static $pubStatProp1;
    public $pubProp1;
    var $pubProp2;
    public static $pubStatProp2;
    public $pubProp3;
    protected static $protStatProp;
    protected $protProp;
    private static $privStatProp;
    private $privProp;
    protected function __construct() {}
    public function __destruct() {}
    public function __toString() {}
    public function pubFunc1() {}
    function pubFunc2() {}
    public static function pubStatFunc1() {}
    public function pubFunc3() {}
    static function pubStatFunc2() {}
    public static function pubStatFunc3() {}
    protected function protFunc() {}
    protected static function protStatFunc() {}
    private static function privStatFunc() {}
    private function privFunc() {}
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Example
{
    public function A(){}
    private function B(){}
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Example
{
    private function B(){}
    public function A(){}
}

configuration.name: imports_order
configuration.description: Defines the order of import types.

configuration.name: sort_algorithm
configuration.description: whether the statements should be sorted alphabetically or by length

configuration.name: assertions
configuration.description: List of assertion methods to fix.

php_unit_construct.summary: PHPUnit assertion method calls like `->assertSame(true, $foo)` should be written with dedicated method like `->assertTrue($foo)`.
php_unit_construct.riskyDescription: Fixer could be risky if one is overriding PHPUnit's native methods.

configuration.name: functions
configuration.description: List of assertions to fix.

php_unit_dedicate_assert.summary: PHPUnit assertions like `assertInternalType`, `assertFileExists`, should be used over `assertTrue`.
php_unit_dedicate_assert.riskyDescription: Fixer could be risky if one is overriding PHPUnit's native methods.

php_unit_fqcn_annotation.summary: PHPUnit annotations should be a FQCNs including a root namespace.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class MyTest extends \PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    /**
     * @expectedException InvalidArgumentException
     * @covers Project\NameSpace\Something
     * @coversDefaultClass Project\Default
     * @uses Project\Test\Util
     */
    public function testSomeTest()
    {
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class MyTest extends \PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    /**
     * @expectedException \InvalidArgumentException
     * @covers \Project\NameSpace\Something
     * @coversDefaultClass \Project\Default
     * @uses \Project\Test\Util
     */
    public function testSomeTest()
    {
    }
}

configuration.name: assertions
configuration.description: List of assertion methods to fix.

php_unit_strict.summary: PHPUnit methods like `assertSame` should be used instead of `assertEquals`.
php_unit_strict.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the functions are overridden or when testing object equality.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class MyTest extends \PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    public function testSomeTest()
    {
        $this->assertAttributeEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertAttributeNotEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertNotEquals(a(), b());
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class MyTest extends \PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    public function testSomeTest()
    {
        $this->assertAttributeSame(a(), b());
        $this->assertAttributeNotSame(a(), b());
        $this->assertSame(a(), b());
        $this->assertNotSame(a(), b());
    }
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class MyTest extends \PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    public function testSomeTest()
    {
        $this->assertAttributeEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertAttributeNotEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertNotEquals(a(), b());
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class MyTest extends \PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    public function testSomeTest()
    {
        $this->assertAttributeEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertAttributeNotEquals(a(), b());
        $this->assertSame(a(), b());
        $this->assertNotEquals(a(), b());
    }
}

configuration.name: only_untyped
configuration.description: Whether to add missing `@param` annotations for untyped parameters only.

phpdoc_add_missing_param_annotation.summary: PHPDoc should contain `@param` for all params.

codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * @param int $bar
 * @param string $foo
 * @param mixed $baz
 *
 * @return void
 */
function f9(string $foo, $bar, $baz) {}

phpdoc_align.summary: All items of the `@param`, `@throws`, `@return`, `@var`, and `@type` PHPDoc tags must be aligned vertically.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * @param  EngineInterface $templating
 * @param string      $format
 * @param  int  $code       an HTTP response status code
 * @param    bool         $debug
 * @param  mixed    &$reference     a parameter passed by reference
 */
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * @param EngineInterface $templating
 * @param string          $format
 * @param int             $code       an HTTP response status code
 * @param bool            $debug
 * @param mixed           &$reference a parameter passed by reference
 */

phpdoc_annotation_without_dot.summary: PHPDoc annotation descriptions should not be a sentence.

phpdoc_indent.summary: Docblocks should have the same indentation as the documented subject.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class DocBlocks
{
/**
 * Test constants
 */
    const INDENT = 1;
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class DocBlocks
{
    /**
     * Test constants
     */
    const INDENT = 1;
}

phpdoc_inline_tag.summary: Fix PHPDoc inline tags, make `@inheritdoc` always inline.

phpdoc_no_access.summary: `@access` annotations should be omitted from PHPDoc.

configuration.name: replacements
configuration.description: Mapping between replaced annotations with new ones.

phpdoc_no_alias_tag.summary: No alias PHPDoc tags should be used.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * @property string $foo
 * @property-read string $bar
 *
 * @link baz
 */
final class Example
{
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * @property string $foo
 * @property string $bar
 *
 * @see baz
 */
final class Example
{
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * @property string $foo
 * @property-read string $bar
 *
 * @link baz
 */
final class Example
{
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * @property string $foo
 * @property-read string $bar
 *
 * @website baz
 */
final class Example
{
}

phpdoc_no_empty_return.summary: `@return` void and `@return null` annotations should be omitted from PHPDoc.

phpdoc_no_package.summary: `@package` and `@subpackage` annotations should be omitted from PHPDoc.

phpdoc_no_useless_inheritdoc.summary: Classy that does not inherit must not have `@inheritdoc` tags.

phpdoc_order.summary: Annotations in PHPDoc should be ordered so that `@param` annotations come first, then `@throws` annotations, then `@return` annotations.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * Hello there!
 *
 * @throws Exception|RuntimeException dfsdf
 * @custom Test!
 * @return int  Return the number of changes.
 * @param string $foo
 * @param bool   $bar Bar
 */
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * Hello there!
 *
 * @custom Test!
 * @param string $foo
 * @param bool   $bar Bar
 * @throws Exception|RuntimeException dfsdf
 * @return int  Return the number of changes.
 */

configuration.name: replacements
configuration.description: Mapping between replaced return types with new ones.

phpdoc_return_self_reference.summary: The type of `@return` annotations of methods returning a reference to itself must the configured one.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Sample
{
    /**
     * @return this
     */
    public function test1()
    {
        return $this;
    }

    /**
     * @return $self
     */
    public function test2()
    {
        return $this;
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Sample
{
    /**
     * @return $this
     */
    public function test1()
    {
        return $this;
    }

    /**
     * @return self
     */
    public function test2()
    {
        return $this;
    }
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Sample
{
    /**
     * @return this
     */
    public function test1()
    {
        return $this;
    }

    /**
     * @return $self
     */
    public function test2()
    {
        return $this;
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Sample
{
    /**
     * @return self
     */
    public function test1()
    {
        return $this;
    }

    /**
     * @return $self
     */
    public function test2()
    {
        return $this;
    }
}

phpdoc_scalar.summary: Scalar types should always be written in the same form. `int` not `integer`, `bool` not `boolean`, `float` not `real` or `double`.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * @param integer $a
 * @param boolean $b
 * @param real $c
 *
 * @return double
 */
function sample($a, $b, $c)
{
    return sample2($a, $b, $c);
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * @param int $a
 * @param bool $b
 * @param float $c
 *
 * @return float
 */
function sample($a, $b, $c)
{
    return sample2($a, $b, $c);
}

phpdoc_separation.summary: Annotations in PHPDoc should be grouped together so that annotations of the same type immediately follow each other, and annotations of a different type are separated by a single blank line.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * Description.
 * @param string $foo
 *
 *
 * @param bool   $bar Bar
 * @throws Exception|RuntimeException
 * @return bool
 */
function fnc($foo, $bar) {}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * Description.
 *
 * @param string $foo
 * @param bool   $bar Bar
 *
 * @throws Exception|RuntimeException
 *
 * @return bool
 */
function fnc($foo, $bar) {}

phpdoc_single_line_var_spacing.summary: Single line `@var` PHPDoc should have proper spacing.

phpdoc_summary.summary: PHPDoc summary should end in either a full stop, exclamation mark, or question mark.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 * Foo function is great
 */
function foo () {}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * Foo function is great.
 */
function foo () {}

phpdoc_to_comment.summary: Docblocks should only be used on structural elements.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
$first = true;// needed because by default first docblock is never fixed.

/** This should not be a docblock */
foreach($connections as $key => $sqlite) {
    $sqlite->open($path);
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
$first = true;// needed because by default first docblock is never fixed.

/* This should not be a docblock */
foreach($connections as $key => $sqlite) {
    $sqlite->open($path);
}

phpdoc_trim.summary: PHPDoc should start and end with content, excluding the very first and last line of the docblocks.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
/**
 *
 * Foo must be final class.
 *
 *
 */
final class Foo {}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
/**
 * Foo must be final class.
 */
final class Foo {}

phpdoc_types.summary: The correct case must be used for standard PHP types in PHPDoc.

phpdoc_var_without_name.summary: `@var` and `@type` annotations should not contain the variable name.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class Foo
{
    /**
     * @var int $bar
     */
    public $bar;

    /**
     * @type $baz float
     */
    public $baz;
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class Foo
{
    /**
     * @var int
     */
    public $bar;

    /**
     * @type float
     */
    public $baz;
}

pow_to_exponentiation.summary: Converts `pow` to the `**` operator. Requires PHP >= 5.6.
pow_to_exponentiation.riskyDescription: Risky when the function `pow` is overridden.

pre_increment.summary: Pre incrementation/decrementation should be used if possible.

protected_to_private.summary: Converts `protected` variables and methods to `private` where possible.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class Sample
{
    protected $a;

    protected function test()
    {
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class Sample
{
    private $a;

    private function test()
    {
    }
}

configuration.name: dir
configuration.description: The directory where the project code is placed.

psr0.summary: Classes must be in a path that matches their namespace, be at least one namespace deep and the class name should match the file name.
psr0.riskyDescription: This fixer may change your class name, which will break the code that is depended on old name.

psr4.summary: Class names should match the file name.
psr4.riskyDescription: This fixer may change your class name, which will break the code that is depended on old name.

configuration.name: replacements
configuration.description: Mapping between replaced functions with the new ones.

random_api_migration.summary: Replaces `rand`, `srand`, `getrandmax` functions calls with their `mt_*` analogs.
random_api_migration.riskyDescription: Risky when the configured functions are overridden.

configuration.name: space_before
configuration.description: Spacing to apply before colon.

return_type_declaration.summary: There should be one or no space before colon, and one space after it in return type declarations, according to configuration.
return_type_declaration.description: Rule is applied only in a PHP 7+ environment.

self_accessor.summary: Inside class or interface element `self` should be preferred to the class name itself.
self_accessor.riskyDescription: Risky when using dynamic calls like get_called_class() or late static binding.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Sample
{
    const BAZ = 1;
    const BAR = Sample::BAZ;

    public function getBar()
    {
        return Sample::BAR;
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Sample
{
    const BAZ = 1;
    const BAR = self::BAZ;

    public function getBar()
    {
        return self::BAR;
    }
}

semicolon_after_instruction.summary: Instructions must be terminated with a semicolon.

short_scalar_cast.summary: Cast `(boolean)` and `(integer)` should be written as `(bool)` and `(int)`, `(double)` and `(real)` as `(float)`.

silenced_deprecation_error.riskyDescription: Silencing of deprecation errors might cause changes to code behaviour.

simplified_null_return.summary: A return statement wishing to return `void` should not return `null`.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
function foo() { return null; }
function bar(): int { return null; }
function baz(): ?int { return null; }
function xyz(): void { return null; }
codeSamples.to:
<?php
function foo() { return; }
function bar(): int { return null; }
function baz(): ?int { return null; }
function xyz(): void { return; }

single_blank_line_at_eof.summary: A PHP file without end tag must always end with a single empty line feed.

single_blank_line_before_namespace.summary: There should be exactly one blank line before a namespace declaration.

configuration.name: elements
configuration.description: List of strings which element should be modified.

single_class_element_per_statement.summary: There MUST NOT be more than one property or constant declared per statement.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class Example
{
    const FOO_1 = 1, FOO_2 = 2;
    private static $bar1 = array(1,2,3), $bar2 = [1,2,3];
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class Example
{
    const FOO_1 = 1;
    const FOO_2 = 2;
    private static $bar1 = array(1,2,3);
    private static $bar2 = [1,2,3];
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php
final class Example
{
    const FOO_1 = 1, FOO_2 = 2;
    private static $bar1 = array(1,2,3), $bar2 = [1,2,3];
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
final class Example
{
    const FOO_1 = 1, FOO_2 = 2;
    private static $bar1 = array(1,2,3);
    private static $bar2 = [1,2,3];
}

single_import_per_statement.summary: There MUST be one use keyword per declaration.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
use Foo, Sample, Sample\Sample as Sample2;
codeSamples.to:
<?php
use Foo;
use Sample;
use Sample\Sample as Sample2;

single_line_after_imports.summary: Each namespace use MUST go on its own line and there MUST be one blank line after the use statements block.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
namespace Foo;

use Bar;
use Baz;
final class Example
{
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
namespace Foo;

use Bar;
use Baz;

final class Example
{
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php
namespace Foo;

use Bar;
use Baz;


final class Example
{
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
namespace Foo;

use Bar;
use Baz;

final class Example
{
}

single_quote.summary: Convert double quotes to single quotes for simple strings.

strict_comparison.riskyDescription: Changing comparisons to strict might change code behavior.

strict_param.summary: Functions should be used with `$strict` param set to `true`.
strict_param.description: The functions "array_keys", "array_search", "base64_decode", "in_array" and "mb_detect_encoding" should be used with $strict param.
strict_param.riskyDescription: Risky when the fixed function is overridden or if the code relies on non-strict usage.

codeSamples.to:
<?php
$a = array_keys($b);
$a = array_search($b, $c, true);
$a = base64_decode($b, true);
$a = in_array($b, $c, true);
$a = mb_detect_encoding($b, $c, true);

switch_case_semicolon_to_colon.summary: A case should be followed by a colon and not a semicolon.

switch_case_space.summary: Removes extra spaces between colon and case value.

ternary_to_null_coalescing.summary: Use `null` coalescing operator `??` where possible. Requires PHP >= 7.0.

trailing_comma_in_multiline_array.summary: PHP multi-line arrays should have a trailing comma.

trim_array_spaces.summary: Arrays should be formatted like function/method arguments, without leading or trailing single line space.

unary_operator_spaces.summary: Unary operators should be placed adjacent to their operands.

configuration.name: elements
configuration.description: The structural elements to fix (PHP >= 7.1 required for `const`).

visibility_required.summary: Visibility MUST be declared on all properties and methods; `abstract` and `final` MUST be declared before the visibility; `static` MUST be declared after the visibility.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Sample
{
    var $a;
    static protected $var_foo2;

    function A()
    {
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Sample
{
    public $a;
    protected static $var_foo2;

    public function A()
    {
    }
}

whitespace_after_comma_in_array.summary: In array declaration, there MUST be a whitespace after each comma.
